author: John Tuero

review: I've been using The Amazon Fire for about a month now and I am quite satisfied with it. I have Apple TV, Tivo and Sony TV apps but have never been happy with the performance/functionality of apps supplied for those systems for both Netflix and Amazon Prime. Using Airplay with the Apple TV and my Ipad was always a hit or miss where Airplay stopped working while watching a show or movie.  While I'm a big Apple fan, airplay became annoying.Amazon Fire provides the solution for this old dude that I was looking for. Both the Netflix and Amazon Prime apps work very well. I also like the fact that when I hit home on the Fire remote my Sony TV will automatically change the input to the Amazon Fire. Other features like voice control I really have no favorable or unfavorable opinion. Kids may like voice control but it's not why I purchased the Fire.
author: David E. Edwards

review: Our TV is still in great shape and didn't want to spend over a thousand dollars to get a new one.I had some Instant Videos I wanted to watch, but my computer chair isn't comfortable to sit long enough to watch a movie.
